oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Lioness and her adopted daughter, Tssi !ku ra Ihin. By /han kass o (L VIII.
8176). The Lioness (in the times of the Early Race) decides to keep a baby girl that she finds and names it Biting
!kuarra |hin), and she grows up. The Lioness tricks a child into sending her brother to her at night, but his grandmothers, !kwa
kau, are also there (they are people and also trees). The Lioness tries to find a way of catching the young man on his own, but Biting
Away protects him and warns him how to behave around her mother. Whenever the Lioness tells a lie when she is near the fire, !kwa
!kwa crackle from within it, causing her to move away. The Lioness kills a gemsbok and Biting
Away and the young man go to help her. The Lioness places some of the meat into a thong that she twists around her body, and asks Biting
Away to help lift her up. While Biting
Away lifts her mother's arms, the husband stabs her exposed flesh with his knife. The young man returns to his own mother's house, bringing Biting
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The story of Tssi
!kuara |hin (the Lioness and her adopted daughter)
